sub_title: EAL Teacher and Home and Identity Language Leader at International School of The Hague

education.field_of_study: Childhood Education (QUEST) and English Language Arts

certifications.name: Education in all subjects and to all groups at the English-language department of schools that fall under Internationally Oriented Primary Education (IGPO)
Teaching English to Speakers of Other Languages (TESOL) Master of Arts

profile_positions.description:
•	Developing and managing home language programmes within the school and after school
•	Promoting flexible Home Language usage with class teachers to support student language and academic learning and further develop whole school multilingual practices
•	Maintaining strong collaboration with the EAL department to ensure a consistent approach around the development of multilingualism
•	Advocating for language equality and supporting multilingual practices in larger, educational networks
profile_positions.title: Home and Identity Language Leader

profile_positions.description:
•	Designing translanguaging lessons and activities that would actively engage and support students in their English language development, both academically and socially 
•	 Fostering and building relationships with diverse English Language Learners and creating a safe and positive learning environment
•	 Writing EAL blog posts and tweets that celebrates the beautiful work of our students and staff
•	 Making IPC Padlets that helps to extend students' learning outside of their classrooms  
•	Conferencing with students in the classrooms during Writing Workshop and using the data for further instruction 
•      Teaching small groups of diverse English Language Learners outside of the classroom for extra support through the use of hands-on activities and technology. 
•	 Assessing newcomers on their English Language Proficiency level with the MAC assessment and meeting with the EAL team to discuss further instruction.
•	Reflecting on students' targets and strengths when filling out their EAL Progress Continuum and using the information to see the student's current English Language proficiency
•	Helping students with complex mathematical language when pushing in into classrooms by using visual aids and Google Translate
•	 Leading two Guided Reading groups of English Language Learners and teaching different reading strategies and elements, while keeping track of students' targets and progress
•	 Attending workshops and conferences to aid in professional and self-development. 
•	 Consulting with parents during Parent-Teacher Conferences and discussing about their child's targets and strengths, as well as what we both can do to help their child succeed in school
•	Discussing with staff about weekly planning, ideas, students' progress and next steps
•	Language of the Month Leader
•	Creating displays of students' work and anchor charts to remind students of their hard work, as well as what we have learned
profile_positions.title: EAL Teacher

profile_positions.description:
•	Provided clear instructions and managed the classroom environment in an effective manner. 
•	Promoted student learning in the absence of a middle school teacher and closely adhering to the teacher’s lesson plans
•	Collaborated with classroom teachers in instruction and assisted students when needed. 
•	Conferred with absent middle school teachers after covering their classes and established a good rapport with them.
profile_positions.title: Daily Substitute Teacher

profile_positions.description:
•	Created lessons and activities that would best fit the 7th and 8th Grade Chinese Bilingual students and teaching them in a meaningful way by incorporating relevant examples and fun and interactive technological resources, such as Kahoot and Quizlet.
•	Prepared students for the NYSESLAT by using i-Ready books and activities to help practice their reading, writing and speaking skills and become familiar with the format of the test.  
•	Fostered and assessed students' reading comprehension and developmental levels by incorporating books clubs that meets the different English proficiency levels in the class.
•	Implemented weekly stationwork that focuses on all modalities (including technology) to help students practice weekly vocabulary, creating an active and supportive learning atmosphere.
profile_positions.title: Long Term Substitute Teacher

profile_positions.description:
• Taught 7th and 8th Grade Chinese Bilingual students from a large range of English proficiency levels by designing and creating lessons and activities that suits each student's needs and has the framework of ELP standards and the ENL curriculum in the school.
•	Worked with a small group of low-proficiency students by using word-picture cards, technological resources and English-Chinese dictionaries to further their English proficiency skills. 
•	Assumed full responsibility of the classroom in the event that the head teacher is late or absent.
profile_positions.title: 7th Grade and 8th Grade ENL Student Teacher

profile_positions.description:
•    Facilitated literature book clubs of various genres to promote meaningful conversation about reading and implemented meaning book projects to celebrate each book. 
•    Taught fourth grade gifted and talented students by modifying curriculum accordingly. 
•    Expertly conducted teaching, evaluation, and grading of students based on their class work, homework, assignments, projects, and exams. 
•    Promoted constant interaction with the students to motivate, inspire, and connect with all students in the classroom. 
•   Collaborated with fourth grade team to plan and implement meaningful lesson plans and projects. 
•   Assumed full responsibility of the classroom in the event that the head teacher is absent. 
•   Tutored a fifth grade student after school with executive functioning issues to improve his success in school.
profile_positions.title: 4th Grade Assistant Teacher

profile_positions.description:
•	Planned and conducted lessons and activities for reading, writing, grammar, math and social studies to meet the diverse needs of students at different developmental levels.
•	Participated in various workshops and conferences for self-development and to support students in the classroom.
•	Tutored struggling students after school in mathematics by reteaching the lesson and tailoring it to students' needs.
•       Used running records to assess students' reading levels and reading comprehension skills. 
•       Celebrated students' work by decorating the bulletin boards to foster a positive classroom community.
profile_positions.title: 6th Grade- Hunter College Student Teacher

profile_positions.description:
•       Created second grade mathematics lesson plans that follows the workshop model and the framework that bridges concrete information to the abstract. 
•       Used differentiated instruction and both formative and summative assessments to evaluate student work. 
•       Encouraged the use of manipulatives and learning math through literature. 
•       Developed mathematical thinking with effective and constant higher-order questioning. 
•       Introduced math morning routines that help build and expand their mathematical conceptual understanding.
profile_positions.title: 2nd Grade- Hunter College Student Teacher

profile_positions.description:
•	Collaborated with the teacher with the needs of the classroom and students.
•	Analyzed students’ work and gave constructive feedback to students for improvement.
•	Gave students support in homework and classwork by helping them 1-on-1 and in small groups.
•	Tutored struggling students after school in Math and English Language Arts by reteaching lessons.
profile_positions.title: Assistant Teacher

profile_positions.description:
•	Created differentiated literacy and social studies lesson plans that spread across various content areas and appealed to different types of learners and learning styles. 
•	Instructed a small reading group and evaluated students’ learning through homework, exams and classwork.
•       Participated in team meetings in order to collaborate on lesson plans and assessed student progress.
•	Did a miscue analysis, closely examining a student’s reading ability (semantics, syntax and pragmatics) and using the results to determine next steps for instruction.
profile_positions.title: 4th Grade- Hunter College Student Teacher

profile_positions.description:
•	Conferred with students during independent reading, giving feedback that helps build their reading comprehension skills. 
•	Created differentiated literacy lesson plans that spread across various content areas and appealed to different types of learners and learning styles. 
•	Supported students during morning enrichment by working with them in math activities and assessing their knowledge.
profile_positions.title: 3rd Grade- Hunter College Student Teacher
